H0.text: Swimming in the ocean is improved by the shape of the marine iguana's long, thick tail.

H1.text: Blending in with rocks is improved by the shape of a marine iguana's long, thick tail, an animal that lives on the shoreline of warm islands.

H2.text: Absorbing nutrients is improved by the shape of the marine iguana's long, thick tail, which is an animal that lives on the shoreline of warm islands.

H3.text: Finding food inland is improved by the long, thick tail of a marine iguana, an animal that lives on the shoreline of warm islands.

A4.text: Their flattened tail is the primary means of propulsion in the water.
